meanings.definition: The position or role of an ombudsman.
meanings.sent1: In her ombudsmanship, she always listens to both sides of the story.
meanings.sent2: His ombudsmanship helped resolve the conflict fairly and impartially.
meanings.sent3: The ombudsmanship of the cat in the house made sure everyone got their fair share of treats.
meanings.sent4: Her ombudsmanship was like a bridge connecting different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The ombudsmanship of the wise owl ensured harmony in the forest.

meanings.definition: The practice or skill of serving as an ombudsman.
meanings.sent1: Training in ombudsmanship is essential for those taking on the role.
meanings.sent2: His ombudsmanship improved over time with experience and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The ombudsmanship of the clown at the party was both entertaining and helpful.
meanings.sent4: Her ombudsmanship shone brightly in times of conflict and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The ombudsmanship of the guide led the group safely through the maze.
